summary: Airports provide transportation access to communities, but aircraft noise can be disruptive. We testified that despite technological advances leading to quieter airplanes, aircraft noise is still a problem for some communities. The Federal Aviation Administration assesses how airplane noise affects communities and conducts public outreach to address concerns. But communities could benefit from FAA sharing more information to help them better understand noise issues, such...
title: Aircraft Noise: FAA Should Improve Efforts to Address Community Concerns
